intro: Lysionotus pterocaulis, commonly known as the mountain morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its climbing habit and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, round berries that contain the seeds, which are dispersed by animals. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Its rapid growth and ornamental flowers make it a popular choice for gardeners in suitable climates.
